Package implementations

Class MyDLL<E>

java.lang.Object
implementations.MyDLL<E>
Type Parameters:
E - element type
All Implemented Interfaces:
ListADT<E>
public class MyDLL<E> extends Object implements ListADT<E>
Doubly-linked list implementation that implements ListADT.

This implementation uses MyDLLNode<E> objects linked in both directions (prev/next). It avoids use of Java collection classes for internal storage, which matches the assignment requirement. The list supports all operations required by ListADT and provides additional convenience methods (e.g., addFirst, addLast, removeFirst, getHead) used by the driver code.

    • size

      Specified by:

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all elements from the list.

      Implementation detail: this method walks the nodes and severs references to help the garbage collector reclaim node objects quickly.

      Postcondition: head == tail == null and size == 0.
      Specified by:
      clear in interface ListADT<E>

    • add

      public boolean add(int index, E toAdd) throws NullPointerException, IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Inserts the specified element at the specified position in this list. Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right. Preconditions:
      • toAdd must not be null (throws NullPointerException).
      • index must be in range 0 <= index <= size.
      Postcondition: the new element is inserted and size increases by 1.
      Specified by:
      add in interface ListADT<E>
      Parameters:
      index - position at which to insert (0-based, may equal size to append)
      toAdd - element to insert
      Returns:
      true if addition succeeded
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if toAdd is null
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range

      public boolean addAll(ListADT<? extends E> toAdd) throws NullPointerException

      Specified by:

      Returns:
      true once all elements are appended

      public E[] toArray(E[] toHold) throws NullPointerException
      Returns an array containing all elements in proper sequence; if the provided array toHold has sufficient length it is filled and returned; otherwise a new array of the same runtime type is allocated and returned.
      Specified by:
      toArray in interface ListADT<E>
